contentrichtext.text: {{Redirect|BBA}} The '''Bachelor of Business Administration''' ('''BBA''' or '''B.B.A.''') is a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[commerce]] and [[business administration]]. In most universities, the degree is conferred upon a student after four years of full-time study in one or more areas of business concentrations; see below. The BBA program usually includes general business courses and advanced courses for specific [[Academic major|concentration]]s. The '''BSBA''' (Bachelor of Science in Business Administration) - a variant on this degree {{cite source|date=January 2012}} - usually differs as regards to [[Curriculum#Distribution_requirements|General educational requirements]]. ==Program content== The degree<ref>See for example BBA program outlines at: [http://www.uregina.ca/admin/academic/business_school/majors.htm uregina.ca]; [http://iitrade.ac.in/courses.asp?detail=bba Institute of International Trade]</ref> is designed to give a broad knowledge of the functional areas of a company, and their interconnection, while also allowing for specialization in a particular area. BBA programs thus expose students to a variety of "core subjects" and allow students to specialize in a specific academic area; see [[Masters of Business Administration#Program content|MBA program content]]. The degree also develops the student's practical managerial skills, communication skills and business decision-making capability. Many programs thus incorporate [[training]] and practical experience, in the form of [[case study|case projects]], presentations, [[internship]]s, industrial visits, and interaction with experts from the industry. The [[core curriculum|core topics]] usually comprise: {| |- | valign="top" | *[[Accounting]] *[[Business law]] and [[Business ethics|Ethics]] *[[Economics]] | valign="top" | *[[Corporate finance|Financial management]] *[[Human resource management]] *[[Management Information Systems]] | valign="top" | *[[Marketing]] *[[Operations management]] *[[Organizational behavior]] | valign="top" | *Quantitative techniques ([[business statistics]], [[time value of money|financial mathematics]], [[operations research]]) *[[strategic management]] |} The specializations often include: {| |- | valign="top" | *[[Accountancy|Accounting]] *[[Entrepreneurship]] *[[Finance]] *[[Real Estate]] | valign="top" | *[[Human Resource Management]] *[[International Business]] *[[Information technology]] *[[Legal management]] | valign="top" | *[[Design_management|Design Management]] *[[Management]] *[[Management information systems]] *[[Marketing]] | valign="top" | *[[Operations management]] *[[Supply chain management]] *[[Public Relations]] *[[Aviation Management]]<ref>http://aviation.osu.edu/academics/degree-programs/business/</ref> |} ===BBA=== General educational requirements emphasize [[humanities]] and [[social sciences]] (history, economics, and literature). Coverage of mathematics is generally business related, and is often limited to "Quantitative Applications for Business" or, alternatively, courses in [[business mathematics|Calculus for business]] / Calculus [[Course numbering in North America|101]], and [[business statistics]] / general statistics. ===BSBA=== The BSBA is a variant on the BBA. General educational requirements are relatively Math intensive; further, the general focus may also be more analytic, often allowing for additional quantitative optional coursework. Compare [[Bachelor of Business Science]]. ==Accreditation== Particularly in the United States, [[undergraduate]] Business Administration programs may be [[Educational accreditation|accredited]], thus indicating that the school's educational curriculum meets specific quality standards; see [[Mba#Accreditation|Accreditation]] under MBA.<ref>{{cite web|title=AACSB accredited schools|url=http://www.aacsb.edu/accreditation/AccreditedMembers.asp|publisher=AACSB}}</ref> ==See also== *[[Bachelor of Accountancy]] *[[Bachelor of Business]] *[[Bachelor of Business Science]] *[[Bachelor of Commerce]] *[[Master of Accountancy]] *[[Master of Business Administration]] ==External links and references== {{reflist|2}} {{Academic degrees}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bachelor Of Business Administration}} [[Category:Bachelor's degrees|Business Administration]] [[Category:Business qualifications]] {{edu-stub}}
